revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus at Luxor, Upper Egypt
tldr: The author observed the transit of Venus from Luxor, Upper Egypt, and recorded the times of contact and phenomena. The observations were made using a heliometer constructed by Fraunhofer, and the results were used to determine the precise instant of contact and the accuracy of the chronometer. The author also discussed the challenges faced during the observation and the importance of accurate timekeeping in astronomical studies.
